Right; the point being that Bitcoin's security model need not necessitate transactions commit to signatures.

Every implementation I'm aware of has checkpoints to skip signatures https://github.com/BitcoinUnlimited/BitcoinUnlimited/blob/release/src/chainparams.cpp#L168 … https://github.com/bcoin-org/bcoin/blob/11a660aeabec7401710c9dacda2f3fee14c82a55/lib/protocol/networks.js#L82 … https://github.com/btcsuite/btcd/blob/c065733c3198ec69a114ef85f45f83ff66205dad/blockchain/checkpoints.go …

Bitcoin's blockchain is currently 60% larger than it needs to be; it's full of unnecessary historical data. This data is called signatures.
